Who You Are:
The IT Security Operations (SecOps) Manager is responsible for leading and managing the security operations team that protects the organization from cyber threats and impact from related incidents. The IT Security Operations Manager oversees all Security Operations Center (SOC) activities, such as the security monitoring, analysis, and response activities, and ensures compliance with security policies and standards agreed.
This role will also manage the relation with the (external) team, ensure reporting is as agreed and within the defined targets / SLAâ€™s. This role is a process-oriented role and does not manage people.
Position Summary:
Together with the SecOps team develop and maintain the security metrics and dashboards, and report on the SecOps performance and effectiveness to senior management and other stakeholders.
Monitor health and security of global infrastructure, addressing operational issues.
Streamline/automate operational practices.
Lead, and supervise the security operations team, and provide guidance and feedback on their performance and development.
Ensures that services meet the agreed Service levels and identifies improvements in the overall service delivery.
Supports in establishing and maintaining the security operations center (SOC) strategy, and objectives, and align them with the organization's goals and priorities.
Define and implement the security operations processes, procedures, and best practices, and ensure they are followed by the team and other stakeholders (e.g. by SOPâ€™s, Playbooks, automation).
Involved in the selection of security operations tools and technologies used, and evaluate and recommend new solutions to enhance the SOC capabilities and efficiency.
Oversee the monitoring and analysis of security events and alerts from various sources, and the response and remediation actions.
Conduct and oversee the security incident investigations, and prepare and deliver the incident reports and lessons learned.
Collaborate and communicate with other security teams, IT teams, business units, and external partners to ensure the security operations alignment and integration.
What You Will Bring (RequiredÂ Qualifications):
Fluent in English
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and ability to handle complex and high-pressure situations
Strong communication and presentation skills, and ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor's degree in computer science, information security, or related field, or equivalent work experience
Minimum 2 years of experience in leading and managing security teams or at least a strong ambition to do so
Education (Minimum Level)
Bachelor's
Field of Study
Computer Science or related field
Years of Experience (Minimum)
5 - 7 years
Preferred Qualifications:
Professional security certifications, such as CISSP, CISM, GCIH, GCIA, or equivalent are a plus.
Strong knowledge and understanding of security technologies, such as SIEM, IDS/IPS, firewall, antivirus, etc.
Knowledge and understanding of security frameworks, standards, and best practices, such as NIST, ISO, PCI, etc.
Management skills, and ability to motivate and inspire the team
Minimum 2 years of experience in security operations, preferably in a SOC environment

company: Bridge Data Centres Malaysia Sdn Bhd
descriptions:
Your key responsibilities are:
Management of our Occupational Health, Environmental and Safety Management Systems and initiatives for our Data Centre facilities in Malaysia.
Overall responsibility of development, implementing and monitoring Occupational Health, Environmental and Safety programs. This role will manage compliance and monitor all in-house staffs and outsourced contractor compliance with relevant regulations and legislation, and lead EHS risk assessment and method statements across all our Data Centre sites to ensure teams are meeting contractual and legal responsibilities and requirements
Inspect and evaluate the environment, equipment and processes in working areas to ensure compliance with our customer requirements, government EHS regulations and applicable industry standards.
Familiar with ISO 14001 and 45001 application process and co-lead our organization to obtain these two ISO certifications by 2Q2022. Candidate is responsible to develop EHS operational handbook, best practices, processes (e.g. SOP & EOP), etc. and implement on site.
Requirements:
Good knowledge of all laws that govern for Occupational Health, Safety and Environment for Data Centre related building management and maintenance, including building safety, emergency evacuation and environmental protection.
Bachelor of Science degree (preferred but not necessary) - preferably in Safety Engineering, Environmental Science or EHS related discipline.
Must be registered/certified EHS Officer in Malaysia
Other Professional EHS Certifications (e.g. Certified Environmental, Safety and Health, Charter Safety and Health Practitioner, Certified Professional Environment Auditor, Certified Safety Health Manager, Certified chartered Generalist OHS professional, and/or others) would add credentials.
Conversant in ISO 14001, ISO 45001 and all Malaysia EHS legislation including OSH Act, Factories & Machinery Act, Fire Services Act, Environmental legislation and subsidiary regulations
Minimum of 8-10 yearsâ€™ experience (preferred but not necessary) of progressive experience leading EHS with heavy emphasis in safety, loss prevention and/or industrial hygiene in manufacturing operations and proven results leading and managing compliance and EHS management systems.

descriptions:
Company Background
We are representing our client who handles e-commerce operations through their full-fledged management system and fulfilment solutions. As they are expanding their business, they are looking for
Data Analyst
to join the team!

Provide competitor analysis
Evaluation of the effectiveness of sales and marketing tools and mechanics
Creating and developing tools for analysis and information processing
Presenting the results of reports and graphical modeling of data
Work closely with the e-Commerce sales team to increase sales and revenue
Develop and maintain data pipelines to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and availability
Develop and maintain e-Commerce dashboards as per clientâ€™s requests
Providing insight to the e-Commerce sales team to optimize marketing expenses
Data Review: reviewing and validating data from various sources (e.g. Lazada, Shopee, etc.) to ensure data quality and accuracy
Job Requirements:
Diploma or Bachelorâ€™s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Min
1 - 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst/Business Analyst/Category Management preferably in E-Commerce or FMCG industry
Advanced Excel and data mining skills
Proficient in data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI) and database query languages (e.g. SQL)
Knowledge of Cloud Computing is an added advantage (e.g. Azure)
Familiarity with Azure Data Factory and Azure Synapse Pipelines is an added advantage
Ability to work independently and take the lead in projects
Strong presentation skills
Job Details:
Permanent employment

siti(at)talentrecruit.com.my
. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

JOB OBJECTIVES
We are seeking for a skilled individual to join our team as an IT System Administrator on a one-year contract basis. This role will be responsible for IT System Administration, maintain and manage our installed system environment, server hardware, Hyperconverged infrastructure and backup operations.
KEY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Assist AVP IT System Administration in managing Servers and IT infrastructure as follows:
To install and administer virtual and physical servers.Â Able to troubleshoot and support VMware operational issues.
To administer and troubleshoot backup issues on Veritas Netbackup.
To maintain and update Windows Server and Linux Server kernel.
To maintain and to perform backup and recovery of the systems in a timely manner.
To perform hardening on new server deployment and ensure the system complies with yearly Vulnerability Assessment & Penetration Test report.
To ensure preventive maintenance on systems is on schedule.
To plan and participate in disaster recovery activities.
Managing Server on Prem and Cloud
Provide User Support in the event EUC team not available.
Assist in IT infra team in administrative (i.e Purchasing, Documentation, Audit, Change Management)
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Recognized degree in Information Technology
Minimum 3 years of technical and administrative experience in Wintel, Linux, Virtualization (VMWare and Hyper-V), Backup and Recovery, including replication.
Certification in VMware technologies preferred.
Experience with Veritas Netbackup
Familiarity with Active Directory, DNS, and Group Policy
Certification in Linux Server (e.g., Red Hat Enterprise Linux or Oracle Enterprise Linux) is advantageous.
Knowledge in HPE Simplivity is a plus.
Experience with Oracle VM, Oracle Maxrep, Weblogic Server, Citrix Virtual Apps & Desktop, Cyberark Privileged Access Management, and cloud platforms such as Office365 is advantageous.
Minimum 1-3 years of experience in Cloud Hosting
Technically inclined with a keen interest in new technologies
Good attitude and team player with effective communication skills
Possess initiative, responsibility, and ability to work independently.
Resourcefulness is essential in this role.

Job Description
1. Equipment and facilities Maintenance:
Inspect and maintain various kitchen equipment, including ovens, grills, fryers, and food processors.
Conduct routine calibration of equipment to ensure precision and optimal performance.
Implement a proactive maintenance schedule to prevent equipment breakdowns and extend their lifespan.
Collaborate with suppliers to source quality spare parts and components for repairs.
Assist HOD in establishing and maintaining relationships with equipment suppliers, service providers, and contractors.
Negotiate service contracts and agreements to ensure cost-effectiveness and optimal service levels.
Update and maintain an inventory of spare parts to facilitate efficient repairs.
Train and guide kitchen crew staff on proper equipment handling and maintenance procedures.
Assist HOD on research and recommend technological upgrades to enhance equipment efficiency and production capacity.
2. Mechanical Systems:
Monitor and maintain HVAC systems, ensuring proper temperature and ventilation in the central kitchen.
Conduct regular checks on pumps, motors, and conveyors, repairing or replacing components as needed.
Implement preventive maintenance measures for mechanical systems to minimize downtime.
Collaborate with external contractors for specialized maintenance on mechanical equipment.
Optimize plumbing systems to ensure efficient water supply and drainage.
3. Record Keeping:
Maintain comprehensive records of all maintenance activities, including dates, procedures, and outcomes.
Develop a database to track equipment warranties, maintenance schedules, and service contracts.
Prepare reports for management on the overall health of the central kitchen equipment.
4. Collaboration
Coordinate with production and operations teams to schedule maintenance activities without disrupting production.
Work closely with the procurement team to source and evaluate maintenance-related products and services.
Participate in project teams for new equipment installations, providing technical expertise.
Conduct regular feedback sessions with production teams to gather insights for continuous improvement.
5. Emergency Response:
Establish and communicate emergency response protocols for immediate action during equipment breakdowns.
Develop contingency plans for critical equipment failures to minimize production downtime.
Maintain on-call availability for urgent maintenance requirements.
6. Continuous Improvement:
Assist HOD inÂ identifying opportunities for continuous improvement in maintenance processes and efficiency.
Collaborate with the R&D team to integrate innovative technologies for improved equipment performance.
7. Regulatory Compliance/Utilities departmental liaison:
Assist HOD to ensure that all maintenance activities adhere to relevant codes and standards.
Collaborate with regulatory bodies/utility departments such as water and electricity supplies during inspections and troubleshooting works.
Job Requirements:
Qualification: Certificate/Diploma in Electrical/Electronic Engineering (Engineering)
Experience - Min 2 years.
Able to work in Taman Pelangi Indah, Ulu Tiram Johor.

Company Overview
KITZ is Japanese companies and Leading Valve manufacturing in Japan. We are in Malaysia as Valve Sales Company for covering all Malaysia and Brunei Market. 100% subsidiary of KITZ Group. KITZ Group has 36 consolidated companies in Japan and overseas, and well-developed global network. KITZ Corporation, the ultimate parent company, is a company listed on the First Section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange and a valve manufacturer with No.1 market share in Japan and the 3rd in the world. KITZ is a stable company with about 5,000 employees in the group. Good atmosphere and teamwork in the company and group company in ASEAN. Have a chance to have a business trip to the group company in ASEAN and Japan.

Job Description:
The Service Desk provides a single point of contact for all IT problems and enquiries. Service Desk takes responsibility of the total end to end management of all calls (from the initial contact, until the call is closed) and provides End-to End Tier 1 Incident Management support for all Desktop related problems and queries. The Service Desk Analysts are IT-skilled and provide complex technical advice to customers on queries and requests related to all aspects of the desktop area and to ensure that this support meets the established Service Level Agreements and quality standards.
Core responsibilities:
Take and receive all customer calls in a professional and courteous manner as well as providing advice and support.
Follow procedures to ensure all calls are identified as â€˜inâ€™ or â€˜outâ€™ of contracted scope and logged accordingly in the Atos Service Management Tool
Log all calls, using the designated call handling and ticketing system and entering detailed and accurate information
Take end to end responsibility of the logged requests and monitor work progress and service levels
Provide incident, problem and complaint (escalation) management for the in scope services domain
Provide technical assistance to customers on the use of all PCs - encompassing desktop related hardware and software in accordance with service level requirements
Provide advice and guidance to customers on the effective use of the self support portal, desktop systems and their associated software, LAN networks and peripherals
Provide â€œFirst Time Fixâ€ based on contractual scope and obligations
Ensure effective escalation and hand-over of customer enquiries/problems to the correct 2nd line group, client Resolver Groups and/or 3rd party maintenance supplier ensuring accurate information is provided and the process is carried out in a timely manner
Carry out appropriate level of technical investigation prior to escalating to the next level
Keep the customer, when they make follow-up calls, fully informed about the progress of any problems or requests which have been assigned to a support group
Secondary responsibilities :
Provide remotely installation of hardware, software and applications or upgrades on customersâ€™ systems where appropriate
Contact the customers to assess their satisfaction prior to the closing of a call
Keep up to date with changes in the IT systems of the customer and industry
Maintain good and constructive relationships with customers and ensure customer requirements are met within agreed timescales
Provide input to resolve customer complaints and dissatisfaction issues
Provide technical input to projects as requested
Keep up to date with new and emerging technologies
Provide coaching and mentoring support to team members
Skill set & Experience
General
Experience of working in a large customer focused environment;
At least 1 yearâ€™s experience in a customer service industry, preferably IT based
Minimum language certification requirement: JLPT N1/N2
At least 2 years experience of working in a helpdesk/customer handling environment;
Previous working experience in a multinational Service Desk/Helpdesk environment for 1 to 2 years is an definite added advantage
Good interpersonal skills and customer interface skills - both on the phone and in person with customers and colleagues
Good written and verbal communication skills - in particular verbal and telephone enquiry handling skills in business fluent Indonesian speaking
Excellent listening skill
Good analytical skills and an ability to define the precise nature of customer problems
Ability to conceptualize problems
Ability to give specific and clear instructions and problem-solving advice
Ability to organize and prioritize work in an effective manner
Ability to work under pressure and be decisive
Ability to support multiple accounts/customer environment
Methodical and disciplined approach to work
Self motivation, drive and determination to succeed
Good personal time management and task organization
Ability to structure and organize small projects
Ability to work well in a team
Good understanding of customer satisfaction principles and practices
Willing to work on 24x7 shift hours including weekends/public holidays
Technical
In depth knowledge of PC technologies and desktop/server hardware and software architectures
Knowledge of cabling and network architectures
Ability to grasp new technical concepts quickly
In depth knowledge of Microsoft applications used on PCs - MS Office 2003, MS Windows XP knowledge of Lotus Notes mail
Basic understanding of computers and how they are configured
Ability to identify and distinguish between hardware, software, network and server problems;
Skills in the use of PCs and associated software and applications;
Good knowledge of Atos Origin support teams and their interface with customers
Knowledge and experience in the use of customer request recording systems and Atos Service Management Tool
Knowledge and experience in RAS support and general administration
Added Advantage :
Knowledge and experience of MS Server Products - i.e. SMS, TS, Exchange, MOM, SQL, ISA
Knowledge and experience of McAfee Anti Virus products

Blackmores (www.blackmores.com.au) is Australiaâ€™s No.1 vitamin and dietary supplements brand with a legacy of over 90 years and is a publicly listed company employing 1250 people in 13 markets across Asia-Pacific. Headquartered in Australia, Blackmores has its international headquarter in Singapore, a health Innovation Centre in Shanghai, and a state-of-the-art manufacturing facility in Australia.
As a purpose-led, performance-driven organisation, Blackmores Group strives to create remarkable employee experiences through supporting a diverse and inclusive culture, creating leadership that inspires high performance, and providing everyone with opportunities to achieve their professional, personal and wellbeing goals supported by our flexible work practices and family friendly policies
Purpose of role:
A role that helps to deliver Blackmores MYSG business to deliver impactful analysis, reporting and insights to aid in decisions pertaining to the profitability and financial health of the organization includes identification and correction of financial or operational concerns.
Responsibilities include:
Leading and improving the budgeting and forecasting processes including agreeing, reviewing the budget provided by each business units in the organisation.
Coordinating and leading the annual financial planning process which is required to achieve managementâ€™s strategic plan.
Conduct variance analysis comparing between actual performance against budget and/or rolling forecast.
Monitor KPIs, identify the cause of any unexpected variances and provide periodic update to the management.
Prepare periodic management reports and financial reports of various business units or departments.
Maintain and provide master data support on various business units, codes and structures in the reporting system include designing of reporting requirements for operational reports, service level requirements and process KPIs
Perform daily and monthly financial reconciliation and reporting process: sales, COGS and inventory reconciliation include reclassification of stocks withdrawal.
Perform assessment on the sufficiency of provisions and data reconciliation in the systems (i.e. Oracles, GDP and PA) for month end closing
Update cash flow projection based on rolling forecast.
Involve in the finance transformation projects as part of the continuous improvements in Blackmores Group.
Ad-hoc business performance reporting.
Who are you?
Degree in accounting, finance and/or equivalent professional certification;
Minimum 5 years working experience in financial analysis, budgeting, forecasting, or related roles;
Experience in FMCG can be beneficial.
Willingness to adapt to changes in technologies, regulations, and industry trends is essential;
Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to gather inputs for financial planning and analysis processes;
Excellent in MS Excel, Power BI, Planning Analytics, Oracle Fusion or other ERP applications; and
Ability to work independently in a dynamic and fast paced environment.
Aptitude for identifying financial challenges and proposing solutions to improve performance and efficiency
Agencies please note: this recruitment assignment is being managed directly by Blackmores Talent Acquisition team. We will reach out to our preferred agency partners if required. Your respect for this process is appreciated.

Job Requirement:
1. Minimum degree in finance or accounting.
2. More than 5 years of relevant experience.
3. Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., AutoCount).
4. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
5. Knowledge of financial regulations and compliance standards.
6. Experience in financial reporting and analysis.
7. Familiarity with budgeting and forecasting processes.
Job responsibility in the job description:
1. Process Supplier Invoices, Verify Accuracy, and Ensure Timely Payment:
- Collaborate with the procurement team to validate the accuracy of supplier invoices.
- Utilize accounting software to record and track invoices, ensuring adherence to payment
terms.
- Coordinate with relevant departments to resolve any discrepancies in invoices.
2. Liaise with the Bank on Trade Facilities Matter:
- Act as the primary point of contact with the bank regarding trade finance, letters of credit,
and other related matters.
- Ensure compliance with the bank's requirements and regulations.
- Facilitate communication between the finance department and the bank for seamless
transactions.
3. Monitor the Fixed Assets Schedule:
- Regularly update the fixed assets schedule to reflect additions, disposals, and
depreciation accurately.
- Conduct periodic physical verification of fixed assets to reconcile with the records.
4. Update Daily Cash Book Record:
- Maintain a detailed and up-to-date cash book, recording all daily financial transactions.
- Reconcile cash transactions with bank statements regularly.
5. Prepare Bank Reconciliation:
- Reconcile bank statements with the company's financial records.
- Investigate and resolve any discrepancies identified during the reconciliation process.
6. Maintain Proper Accounting Records and Documentation for Audit and Tax:
- Organize and store financial documents in a systematic manner for easy retrieval during
audits.
- Ensure compliance with tax regulations by maintaining accurate and complete
documentation.
7. Assist in Preparation Audit and Tax Process:
- Collaborate with external auditors and tax professionals during audit and tax preparation.
- Provide necessary documentation and information as requested.
8. Manage Day-to-Day Financial and Accounting Operations:
- Oversee routine financial tasks, such as expense approvals, petty cash management, and payroll processing.
- Implement and improve financial processes to enhance efficiency.
9. Cooperate with Other Departments on Preparing Accounting Documents:
- Work closely with various departments to gather financial information for reporting
purposes.
- Provide guidance to non-finance teams on proper documentation and financial
procedures.
10. Ensure Compliance with Accounting Principles and Regulations:
- Stay informed about changes in accounting standards and regulations.
- Implement internal controls to ensure adherence to accounting principles.
11. Other Ad-Hoc Jobs Assigned by Superior:
- Undertake miscellaneous tasks and projects as directed by the supervisor.
- Adapt to changing priorities and contribute to special projects as needed.

Elquator is a growing company, and we need someone to be the right-hand person to our CEO. We're searching for a chief operating officer (COO) who has strong leadership skills and the ability to approach business with a creative point of view. The COO will lead our team of high-performing professionals to be efficient, productive, and effective. The ideal candidate has extensive experience within our industry, preferably having worked their way up to an executive role. We believe this trajectory helps a person develop a unique mix of business and management expertise, plus proficiency with the practices, policies, and procedures of our industry.
Objectives of this role
Collaborate with CEO in setting and driving organizational vision, operations strategy, and hiring levels
Translate strategy into actionable steps for growth, implementing organization-wide goal setting, performance management, and annual operations planning
Oversee company operations and employee productivity, building a highly inclusive culture that ensures team members can thrive and that organizational goals are met
Ensure effective recruiting, onboarding, professional development, performance management, and retention
Ensure compliance with national and local business regulations, and take appropriate action when necessary
Responsibilities:
Analyze internal operations and identify areas for process enhancement
Implement business strategies and plans that align with the short- and long-term objectives developed in tandem with CEO
Oversee operations, HR, and accounting, and partner with CEO in sales management so that sufficient investment capital can be budgeted for near-term growth targets
Manage capital investments and expenses aggressively to ensure that the company achieves investor targets for growth and profitability
Monitor performance with tracking software - take corrective measures when necessary, and prepare detailed updates and forecasts
Build and maintain trusting relationships with key customers, clients, partners, and stakeholders
Required skills and qualifications:
Five or more years of experience in executive leadership roles
Excellent leadership skills, with steadfast resolve and personal integrity
Understanding of advanced business planning and regulatory issues
Solid grasp of data analysis and performance metrics
Ability to diagnose problems quickly and foresee potential issues
Exceptional track record of leadership
Superior project management skills
Resourceful and analytical with exceptional communication skills
Understanding of all facets of business
Outstanding public speaking and interpersonal skills
Knowledge of IT/business infrastructure
Aptitude in problem-solving and decision-making
Understanding of analytics and performance metrics

job_title: Senior Project Management Specialist/Associate Program Manager (APAC)
company: Boston Scientific Medical Device (Malaysia) Sdn. Bhd.
descriptions:
Purpose Statement:
As an Associate Program Manager, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing and driving complex end-to-end programs for Boston Scientific Asia Pacific. This multifaceted position requires a strategic thinker with excellent organizational, planning, influencing, and communication skills. The primary focus of this role is to ensure the successful execution of programs from initiation to completion, with a specific emphasis on change management to facilitate organizational adaptation.
Job Responsibilities:
Project management:
Work closely with stakeholders to develop sound businesses case for decision including project objectives, deliverables and success criteria.
Develop comprehensive project plans, including scope, timelines, stakeholder analysis, communication and resource requirements.
Lead the planning, execution, and closure of end-to-end programs, driving to meet timelines and overall program objectives.
Define training and performance support schedule and manage the design and delivery of training programs by project subject matter experts / process specialists.
Evaluate and ensure user readiness, track and report issues, define and measure success metrics and monitor change progress.
Identifying and mitigating potential risks, maintaining a risk and issues register andÂ implement corrective actions as needed.
Monitor program progress through to stakeholder adoption, business handover and project closure.
Stakeholder Management:
Define overall stakeholder engagement and communication plans, including the design, development, and key communication materials.
Act as the primary point of contact for stakeholders, providing regular updates on status, risks, and issues.
Foster effective communication and collaboration among project team members and stakeholders.
Engage stakeholders at all levels to create awareness, build commitment, ensuring clear communication and understanding of program goals and drive a positive attitude toward change.
Collaborate with country/function teams, and other relevant stakeholders to ensure effective change communication and training programs.
Cultivate strong relationships with key stakeholders, both internal and external, to ensure alignment and support for project objectives.
Resource Management:
Ensure that project team members, change champions and change ambassadors have the necessary tools, training, and support to perform their roles effectively.
Budget Management:
Manage project budgets, ensuring that projects are delivered within financial constraints.
Track project expenses and report on budgetary status regularly.
Quality Assurance:
Adhere to the BSC project management standards, using established methodologies and tools to define the business case, objectives, scope, roles & responsibilities.
Participate in regular reviews to ensure compliance with established standards.
Continuous Improvement:
Identify opportunities for process improvement within the PMO and the broader organization.
Lead and contribute to Value Improvement Programs (VIPs) in the PMO and the broader organization.
Reporting and Documentation:
Prepare regular status reports for key stakeholders and Portfolio managers, providing insights into program performance and highlighting achievements, risks and challenges.
Maintain comprehensive documentation of program plans, processes, and outcomes.
Job Requirements:
Bachelorâ€™s degree in business, Project Management, Change Management or a related fieldÂ or certification in PMP, Change Management, Agile, Six sigma or Lean.
A willingness to work flexibly across different time zones.
Occasional travel to BSC sites in another APAC country may be required.
At least 3 years of relevant experiences and proven results in project and change management with a focus on end-to-end delivery.
Multi country experience
Sound application skills (PPT, Excel, Word, Project)
Excellent communication skills and fluency in both verbal and written English at all levels
Position will be based in Penang or KL.
Working mode: Hybrid (Minimum 3 days onsite)

Summary of role :
This position responsible for the instrument and automation system management of a large-scale Air Separation plant, producing gaseous and liquid oxygen, nitrogen and argon products for our customers. The candidate will need to perform the following for instrumentation and automation system:
Role is based in Kuantan.
Implement the Group's reliability and maintenance strategies, standards, best practices (BOP) and improvement plans to attain and sustain reliability KPI
Lead and coordinate daily site maintenance activities (PM, CM) to ensure tasks are completed as planned
Optimise resources required for routine and major maintenance activities
Troubleshoot failures and recommend solutions, produce lesson learnt to share
Lead root cause investigation for major unreliability events
Job scope
:
Equipment maintenance and reliability management (Instrumentation & automation system)
Demonstrate safe working mindset and champion safe work culture to staff and contractors.
Lead and execute maintenance jobs for equipment such as: field transmitters, control valves, product (LIN/LOX/LAR) and total hydrocarbon analysers, local PLC and DCS hardware and network components, product metering, plant alarm, communication and CCTV system etc to ensure high reliability of such equipment.
Familiar with CMMS system eg: SAP, Maximo or other platforms and able to utilize such system to plan, execute and close work orders for PM and CM.
Familiar with one of the DCS system such as Hollysys, Supcon, Yokogawa, Siemens PCS7, Honeywell etc
Practical experience in field instrument calibration and installation, loop checks, control valve maintenance and installation, analyser configuration and testing, PLC & DCS troubleshooting, basic PLC programming, network testing etc.
Familiar with compressor controls and basic process controls.
Attend daily morning meeting with other disciplines and production team to coordinate efforts in ensuring maintenance works are conducted safely and timely.
Prepare and review technical documents, maintenance manual, work procedures and provide technical training to staff to improve competencies and consistency.
Responsible for instrument measurement tools custody eg: multimeter, signal generators, field calibrator
Perform periodic review of spares, setup material number in CMMS and review/update sparing strategy and plan for replacement of obsolete parts to ensure sufficient spares readily available when needed.
Propose OPEX and CAPEX budgetary proposal for projects, major maintenance and yearly budget planning.
Update on cybersecurity development, digital tools and other latest development for instrumentation and automation system.
Risk management and plant reliability improvement
Familiar with risk assessment documents: JHA, FMEA, MOC
Reduce CM work list by promoting proactive and preventive maintenance strategy in work.
Proactively identify failure modes, evaluate existing mitigation to recommend any further actions and track closure of equipment reliability gap.
Propose new technologies to allow early detection of failures and to resolve it as early as possible.
Ensure major cost of downtime event is investigated and lessons learned are developed and implemented immediately.
Manage systemic corrective actions reports to close gaps versus Group standards.
Knowledge and experience:
Bachelor degree, major in electrical/electronic/automation engineering.
A minimum of 5 years of practical hands-on experience in instrumentation and controls, within the field of industrial gas/petrochemicals/oleochemicals.
Familiar with ISA & IEC standards.
Familiar with ASU operations is a definite advantage.
Familiar with SAP system maintenance module is an advantage.
